answers.answer: A lot goes into figuring out if your blood sugar is too high....when you ate, what you ate, excercize etc.  I am newly diagnosed myself and have found that a site called American Diabetes Association is very helpful.Also, ask your Dr. if you can go to patient education classes or if there is a registered dietition you could go to.Check with your insurance if you have any to see if they offer any programs where they send you info and call you to help you out.Hope this helps,Krista

also when testing your blood sugar, when you tested it has a lot to do with whether it is high or not.  If that is an after meal test, then no it is fine, if it is before some doctors will recommend that they be lower.  I have been diabetic for almost 20 years and as stated above, a lot goes into if any blood sugar reading is high or not.  I wish you the best of luck in learning more about diabetes.

question: I just found out that I have diabetes my blood suger count is 133 right now is that to high?I have still alot to learn with and injury that hasn't healed in a year and a half I guess due to this I didn't know til aboui 3 days ago?
title: Trying to learn more?Need Help?
